thread.title: New music: Muncie Girls' new album makes them Metro.co.uk's artist of the day, 21/02 | Metro News
thread.title_full: New music: Muncie Girls' new album makes them Metro.co.uk's artist of the day, 21/02 | Metro News

author: Achal Dhillon For Metro.Co.Uk
title: New music: Muncie Girls' new album makes them Metro.co.uk's artist of the day, 21/02 | Metro News
text:
Muncie Girls sound like : friendship bracelets, beach breaks, blue skies and broken hearts. 
Similar artists : The Primitives, Hop Along, The Donnas, Tsunami Bomb 
Their story : Muncie Girls formed in 2010 when local Exeter DIY scene chums Lande, Dean and Luke got together 
The trio played local shows supporting bands that would tour through the area before signing to Exeter-based label Specialist Subject. 
A couple of EPs followed, ending up with airtime on BBC Radio 1’s Rock Show. 
The band recently released their debut album From Caplan To Belsize, supporting emo/pop-punk stalwarts Taking Back Sunday on their latest UK tour. 
What’s so great about them : Muncie Girls are a true DIY British success story. 
Their songwriting speaks on behalf of their peers, young adults growing up in the late noughties. 
Channelling their innermost anxieties, hopes and desires into one full length is about as endearing as the music business gets these days. 
Lead vocalist and bass player Lande Hekt’s unique take on lyricism channels her perspective on life. 
Most-streamed song on Spotify: Respect (over 95,000 listens so far) 
Most viewed video : 
What will they be doing in 2017 : Having only just jumped off a tour with Taking Back Sunday last week, the band have PRS Foundation grant funding to fund their upcoming trip to SXSW in Austin, Texas. 
Following that, the band have announced a string of UK festival jaunts – Manchester Punk Festival and 2000 Trees to name a couple – and doubtless there will be more live activity on the way. 
Signed to : Specialist Subject Records (UK), Uncle M Music (EU) and Animal Style Records (US).
